definition: to get or supply meals for a monthly rate/to board/to cater
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
gimbap (Korean rice roll similar in appearance to sushi)/kimbap

sentences.english: Mary boards at her aunt 's sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 有时，玛丽在她的姑妈家包饭。

sentences.english: Mrs. Jones makes a living by boarding students.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯太太靠给学生们包饭谋生。

sentences.english: Are you a fan of turkey, Korean laver take boarder, or Chinese hot pot?
sentences.chinese: 你钟情于火鸡，紫菜包饭，还是火锅？

sentences.english: As captain, whose beard stained with egg board without knowing.
sentences.chinese: 就如上校，胡子沾上蛋包饭而不自知。

sentences.english: My aunt boards holiday-makers during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，我姑妈为渡假者包饭。

sentences.english: My aunt boards holiday - makers during the summer.
sentences.chinese: 夏天，我姑妈为度假者包饭。

sentences.english: Head to the sushi station for a protein-packed prepared meal.
sentences.chinese: 前往寿司店购买含有蛋白质的包饭。

sentences.english: They who gobble their rice off a leaf
sentences.chinese: 吞吃粽叶包饭的他们吓得要死。

definition: gimbap (Korean rice roll similar in appearance to sushi)/kimbap
plain cooked rice/rice with nothing to go with it
